orangelight.title: Determine where submissions should be collected for the biased search results form

comments.body:
According to the proposed workflow in [this document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rDMpdCmf4TMTo2O2L3Jiy9f-V16HZ4jZvPwxoP0pZJ8/edit), submissions would be collected in a dedicated LibAnswers queue for reporting biased search results, in line with the workflows used by IRMWG.  This queue would include representation from DLS, DACS, RDSS (likely entire teams).  These representatives would be the first to triage form submissions and then loop in appropriate parties (such as IRMWG, AUX, DSSG, and more) to respond to issues.  

It has been proposed that reviewing the LibAnswers queue and claiming unclaimed submissions would be part of the duties of the runner for each team (see [runner documentation for RDSS](https://github.com/pulibrary/rdss-handbook/blob/main/runner.md) for an explanation of the runner role).

orangelight.title: Design the biased search results reporting form

comments.body: Based on a discussion the team had during today's check-in, we are going to simplify the initial deliverable by creating a link to the search results the user is reporting on instead of re-creating/i-framing the search results in the form modal. This link should open a new tab to prevent the user from losing any content they may have entered in the form.
Work ongoing for this in #3789

Per the comment in #3777:

`
Based on a discussion the team had during today's check-in, we are going to simplify the initial deliverable by creating a link to the search results the user is reporting on instead of re-creating/i-framing the search results in the form modal. This link should open a new tab to prevent the user from losing any content they may have entered in the form.
`
